intro: Galium pilosissimum, commonly known as the silky bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its creeping, stoloniferous growth habit and hairy stems that give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its overall textured look. Galium pilosissimum is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
